CTA.TITLE: Take it to the next level
CTA.SUBTITLE: Try LocaGuest today and simplify your management

FOOTER.DESCRIPTION: The simple and modern solution for rental management.

INTRO.TITLE: Introduction
INTRO.CONTENT: LocaGuest is committed to protecting the privacy of your personal data. This policy describes how we collect, use and protect your information.

DATA_COLLECTED.TITLE: Data Collected
DATA_COLLECTED.CONTENT: We collect information you provide during registration (name, email, phone), as well as data related to your use of our service (properties, tenants, contracts, payments).

DATA_USE.TITLE: Data Use
DATA_USE.CONTENT: Your data is used to provide and improve our services, send you important notifications, and ensure the security of your account.

DATA_PROTECTION.TITLE: Data Protection
DATA_PROTECTION.CONTENT: We use technical and organizational security measures to protect your data against unauthorized access, modification or destruction.

RIGHTS.TITLE: Your Rights
RIGHTS.CONTENT: Under GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, delete and port your data. You can exercise these rights by contacting us.

CONTACT.TITLE: Contact
CONTACT.CONTENT: For any questions regarding this policy, contact us at: contact@locaguest.com

ACCEPTANCE.TITLE: Acceptance of Terms
ACCEPTANCE.CONTENT: By using LocaGuest, you accept these terms of service. If you do not accept these terms, please do not use our service.

SERVICE.TITLE: Service Description
SERVICE.CONTENT: LocaGuest is a rental management platform that allows owners and managers to track their properties, tenants, contracts and payments.

ACCOUNT.TITLE: User Account
ACCOUNT.CONTENT: You are responsible for the confidentiality of your login credentials and all activities performed under your account.

PRICING.TITLE: Pricing
PRICING.CONTENT: Pricing for our different plans is available on our pricing page. We reserve the right to change our prices with 30 days notice.

LIMITATION.TITLE: Limitation of Liability
LIMITATION.CONTENT: LocaGuest cannot be held responsible for indirect damages resulting from the use of our service. Our liability is limited to the amount of fees paid for the service.

HERO.TITLE: All the features to manage your properties
HERO.SUBTITLE: Discover how LocaGuest simplifies rental management with powerful and intuitive tools.

PRICING.SUBTITLE: Simple and transparent pricing. Change plans anytime.

HELP_PAGE.TITLE: Help Center
HELP_PAGE.SUBTITLE: Find answers to your questions quickly

Q1.Q: How do I create my first property?
Q1.A: From the dashboard, click 'Add Property' and fill in the required information. You can add photos, financial details, and diagnostics.

Q2.Q: How do I invite team members?
Q2.A: Go to Settings > Team, then click 'Invite Member'. Enter the email and select the appropriate role.

Q3.A: We offer a Free plan to get started, a Pro plan for active owners, and an Enterprise plan for professional managers.

Q1.Q: How do I edit property information?
Q1.A: Click on the property, then go to the 'Information' tab. Click 'Edit' to update the details.

Q2.Q: How do I add photos to a property?
Q2.A: In the property details, use the 'Photos' section to upload your images. You can organize them by category.

Q3.Q: How do I manage multiple properties?
Q3.A: All your properties are listed in 'My LocaGuest'. You can easily filter and search.

Q1.Q: How do I add a new tenant?
Q1.A: In a property's details, go to the 'Tenants' tab and click 'Add Tenant'. Fill in their contact and personal information.

Q2.Q: How do I track a tenant's payments?
Q2.A: Payment history is visible in the tenant's profile and in the 'Payments' tab of the relevant property.

Q1.Q: How do I record a received payment?
Q1.A: In the property's 'Payments' tab, click 'Add Payment' and enter the details (amount, date, type).

Q2.Q: How do I generate a rent receipt?
Q2.A: In the relevant payment's details, click 'Generate Receipt'. The PDF document will be automatically created.

Q3.Q: How do I get notified of late payments?
Q3.A: Enable payment notifications in Settings > Notifications. You will receive automatic alerts.

Q1.Q: What types of documents can I store?
Q1.A: You can store any type of document: leases, diagnostics, invoices, photos, certificates, etc.

Q2.Q: How do I share a document with a tenant?
Q2.A: In the Documents section, select the file and click 'Share'. You can send a secure link.

Q1.Q: How do I change my password?
Q1.A: Go to Settings > Security, then click 'Change Password'. Enter your old and new password.

Q2.Q: How do I enable two-factor authentication?
Q2.A: In Settings > Security, enable '2FA'. Scan the QR code with your authenticator app.

Q3.Q: How do I delete my account?
Q3.A: In Settings > Preferences, scroll down to 'Danger Zone' and click 'Delete My Account'. This action is irreversible.

STILL_NEED_HELP.TITLE: Didn't find your answer?
STILL_NEED_HELP.DESC: Our team is available to help you personally.

STEP_1.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 1/12: Header
STEP_1.DESC: This header contains global actions: theme, notifications and user menu.

STEP_2.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 2/12: Main tabs
STEP_2.DESC: Use this bar to navigate between the main sections of the application.

STEP_3.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 3/12: Dashboard
STEP_3.DESC: Access your overview (KPIs, shortcuts, recent activity).

STEP_4.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 4/12: Mon LocaGuest
STEP_4.DESC: Manage your properties, tenants, relationships and related actions (detail pages).

STEP_6.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 6/12: Documents
STEP_6.DESC: Browse and manage your documents (contracts, receipts, attachments, etc.).

STEP_7.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 7/12: Accounting & Projections
STEP_7.DESC: Analyze your performance (revenue, expenses, net profit, charts).

STEP_8.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 8/12: Profitability calculator
STEP_8.DESC: Simulate and compare profitability scenarios (financing, expenses, ROI).

STEP_9.TITLE: Navigation ‚Äî Step 9/12: Settings
STEP_9.DESC: Configure the application (preferences, organization, notifications, etc.).

STEP_10.TITLE: Header ‚Äî Step 10/12: Theme
STEP_10.DESC: Switch between light and dark theme.

STEP_11.TITLE: Header ‚Äî Step 11/12: Notifications
STEP_11.DESC: View your notifications and quickly access pending actions.

STEP_1.TITLE: Accounting & Projections ‚Äî Step 1/5: Header
STEP_1.DESC: This page provides an overview of your performance: revenue, expenses, net profit and profitability.

STEP_2.TITLE: Accounting & Projections ‚Äî Step 2/5: Filters
STEP_2.DESC: Adjust the period and year to refresh the analysis and the chart.

STEP_1.TITLE: Filters ‚Äî Step 3/5: Period
STEP_1.DESC: Choose how many months to display in the evolution chart (3, 6, 9 or 12).

STEP_2.TITLE: Filters ‚Äî Step 4/5: Year
STEP_2.DESC: Select the year to analyze your data for the chosen period.

STEP_1.TITLE: Statistics ‚Äî Overview
STEP_1.DESC: These cards summarize key indicators (revenue, expenses, net profit, profitability rate).

STEP_2.TITLE: Statistics ‚Äî Monthly revenue
STEP_2.DESC: Total monthly revenue, with change compared to last month.

STEP_3.TITLE: Statistics ‚Äî Monthly expenses
STEP_3.DESC: Total monthly expenses, with change compared to last month.

STEP_4.TITLE: Statistics ‚Äî Net profit
STEP_4.DESC: Difference between revenue and expenses. A key performance indicator.

STEP_5.TITLE: Statistics ‚Äî Profitability rate
STEP_5.DESC: Track your profitability rate and compare it to the target.

STEP_1.TITLE: Chart ‚Äî Evolution
STEP_1.DESC: Compare revenue and expenses over the selected period.

STEP_1.TITLE: Performance by property
STEP_1.DESC: Analyze profitability per property (revenue, expenses, profit and ROI).

STEP_1.TITLE: Step 1/8 ‚Äî Tabs bar (navigation)
STEP_1.DESC: Use this bar to navigate between your internal tabs (Summary, Property details, Tenant details, Relation). Click a tab to switch views.

STEP_2.TITLE: Step 2/8 ‚Äî Summary tab (starting point)
STEP_2.DESC: The Summary tab is your main overview. You‚Äôll find your properties/tenants list, quick actions, and a snapshot of alerts.

STEP_3.TITLE: Step 3/8 ‚Äî Quick actions
STEP_3.DESC: Use these buttons to quickly create a new tenant or a new property. After creation, the lists refresh automatically.

STEP_4.TITLE: Step 4/8 ‚Äî Switch Properties / Tenants
STEP_4.DESC: Choose what you want to see: the Properties list or the Tenants list. This also updates the search and filters accordingly.

STEP_5.TITLE: Step 5/8 ‚Äî Fast search
STEP_5.DESC: Type here to filter the list. The search is applied automatically after a short delay to avoid unnecessary reloads.

STEP_6.TITLE: Step 6/8 ‚Äî Clickable list (open a detail tab)
STEP_6.DESC: Click an item to open its detail view in a new internal tab. Example: clicking a property opens the Property tab; clicking a tenant opens the Tenant tab.

STEP_7.TITLE: Step 7/8 ‚Äî Notifications
STEP_7.DESC: This area shows recent activities and important notifications. It helps you keep track of events, reminders and pending actions.

STEP_8.TITLE: Step 8/8 ‚Äî Upcoming deadlines
STEP_8.DESC: Here you can see upcoming important dates (for example contract-related milestones). Check it regularly to stay on track.

STEP_1.TITLE: Property detail ‚Äî Step 1/2: navigation
STEP_1.DESC: You are on a Property detail. The tour adapts automatically to the currently visible sub-tab (Information / Tenants / Contracts).

STEP_2.TITLE: Property detail ‚Äî Step 2/2: sub-tabs
STEP_2.DESC: Use these sub-tabs to switch sections: Information (edit + photos), Tenants (occupancy), Contracts (create & actions).

STEP_1.TITLE: Property > Information ‚Äî Step 1/4: Edit
STEP_1.DESC: Click ‚ÄúEdit‚Äù to enter edit mode and update the property information (address, details, etc.).

STEP_2.TITLE: Property > Information ‚Äî Step 2/4: Print sheet
STEP_2.DESC: Generate the property PDF sheet for archiving, sending or printing.

STEP_3.TITLE: Property > Information ‚Äî Step 3/4: Add photos
STEP_3.DESC: Add photos to the property (e.g. exterior, kitchen, bedroom). They appear in the carousel for quick preview.

STEP_4.TITLE: Property > Information ‚Äî Step 4/4: Delete photo
STEP_4.DESC: Delete the currently displayed photo from the carousel. Warning: deletion is immediate.

STEP_1.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 1/4: Display mode
STEP_1.DESC: Switch between card view and list view to better read occupancy information.

STEP_2.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 2/4: Occupancy list
STEP_2.DESC: This area shows tenants associated with the property and the status of their file (payments, documents, status).

STEP_3.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 3/4: Open tenant detail
STEP_3.DESC: Click the avatar/name to open the tenant detail in a new internal tab.

STEP_4.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 4/4: Dissociate
STEP_4.DESC: Use dissociation to remove the tenant/property association (subject to rules: active/signed contracts).

STEP_5.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 5/8: Profile
STEP_5.DESC: Quickly open the tenant detail (contacts, status, payments, documents).

STEP_6.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 6/8: Contract
STEP_6.DESC: Open the tenant contract linked to this property to review details and available actions.

STEP_7.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 7/8: Addendum
STEP_7.DESC: Create an addendum to update some lease terms (rent, dates, conditions‚Ä¶).

STEP_8.TITLE: Property > Tenants ‚Äî Step 8/8: Renew
STEP_8.DESC: Start the lease renewal process (often available near the contract end date).

STEP_1.TITLE: Property > Contracts ‚Äî Step 1/4: New contract
STEP_1.DESC: Create a new lease contract for this property. The button can be disabled when the property is already occupied.

STEP_2.TITLE: Property > Contracts ‚Äî Step 2/4: Paper contract
STEP_2.DESC: Start a ‚Äúpaper‚Äù contract if you manage signature outside the application.

STEP_3.TITLE: Property > Contracts ‚Äî Step 3/4: Inventory
STEP_3.DESC: Add/manage inventories (entry/exit) linked to the contract.

STEP_4.TITLE: Property > Contracts ‚Äî Step 4/4: Contract actions
STEP_4.DESC: Actions depend on status: renew, addendum, notice, inventories, view, PDF, history‚Ä¶

STEP_1.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 1/6: context
STEP_1.DESC: You are on a Tenant detail. The tour adapts automatically to the currently visible sub-tab.

STEP_2.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 2/6: identity
STEP_2.DESC: Find key information (name, code, email/phone) and the associated property when available.

STEP_3.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 3/6: print
STEP_3.DESC: Generate and download the tenant PDF sheet (useful for file/archiving).

STEP_4.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 4/6: rental status
STEP_4.DESC: Track occupancy, lease dates and financial indicators (balance, arrears, last payment).

STEP_5.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 5/6: global actions
STEP_5.DESC: Depending on context, global actions may appear (e.g. dissociate from property). Some actions can be blocked.

STEP_6.TITLE: Tenant detail ‚Äî Step 6/6: sub-tabs
STEP_6.DESC: Navigate between Contracts, Payments, Payment history and Documents to manage the full tenant file.

STEP_1.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 1/5: New contract
STEP_1.DESC: Create a contract for the tenant (depending on rules/permissions).

STEP_2.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 2/5: Contracts list
STEP_2.DESC: Review existing contracts and their status (signed, active, notice, addendums).

STEP_3.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 3/5: Open related property
STEP_3.DESC: Click a contract to open the related property detail in a new internal tab.

STEP_4.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 4/5: Contract documents
STEP_4.DESC: Open/close the Documents panel to track the status of contract documents.

STEP_5.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 5/5: Actions
STEP_5.DESC: Access available actions depending on status: renew, addendum, notice, inventories, PDF, etc.

STEP_6.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 6/12: Renew
STEP_6.DESC: Renew the lease when allowed (often close to the contract end date).

STEP_7.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 7/12: Addendum
STEP_7.DESC: Create an addendum to update the current contract (e.g. rent, dates, clauses).

STEP_8.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 8/12: Notice
STEP_8.DESC: Trigger a notice / contract termination depending on context and permissions.

STEP_9.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 9/12: View
STEP_9.DESC: View the contract document to verify its content or share it.

STEP_10.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 10/12: Exit inventory
STEP_10.DESC: Create the exit inventory when the tenant leaves the property (when available).

STEP_11.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 11/12: PDF
STEP_11.DESC: Download the contract PDF (and the addendum PDF when available).

STEP_12.TITLE: Tenant > Contracts ‚Äî Step 12/12: History
STEP_12.DESC: Open the contract history to track events and actions over time.

STEP_1.TITLE: Tenant > Payments ‚Äî Step 1/4: Statistics
STEP_1.DESC: Quickly see total paid, remaining amount and late payments.

STEP_2.TITLE: Tenant > Payments ‚Äî Step 2/4: Add payment
STEP_2.DESC: Record a payment (month/year, amount, method, date) to update the situation.

STEP_3.TITLE: Tenant > Payments ‚Äî Step 3/4: Deposit
STEP_3.DESC: Record the security deposit linked to the tenant.

STEP_4.TITLE: Tenant > Payments ‚Äî Step 4/4: Payments table
STEP_4.DESC: Review due dates and use actions (e.g. download a receipt for a paid payment).

STEP_1.TITLE: Tenant > History ‚Äî Step 1/1: summary
STEP_1.DESC: See a financial summary (total paid, due amounts, arrears) to analyze the situation over time.

STEP_1.TITLE: Tenant > Documents ‚Äî Step 1/1: documents manager
STEP_1.DESC: Manage tenant documents (upload, view, validate) depending on your permissions.

PERFORMANCE.TITLE: Performance by property
PERFORMANCE.SUBTITLE: Comparative analysis of profitability for each property
